channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Earnings watch: Can anything stop Walmart’s rally?
America’s population growth is slowing. That’s bad news for these investments.
'Drill, baby, drill' and tariffs: Which stocks stand to gain or lose
The Tisch family just appointed its third generation of CEO at $18.5 billion Loews Corporation—he’s pledging to focus on one job
item.description: The Tisch family count the New York Giants and Loews Corporation as among their interests.

item.title: Here’s how Intel’s stock charts look after its big rally. Should you buy it?
‘Trump trades’ like dollar and bitcoin are stalling, while Chinese stocks gain
Zuckerberg’s new policy chief warns EU Meta will run to Trump whenever the tech giant feels it’s being unfairly punished by Brussels
item.description: The warning comes after Zuckerberg pledged to join President Trump in pushing back on governments around the world that go after American companies.

item.title: These founders and investors want the longevity industry to cater to women—whatever their budget
item.description: Male biohackers shouldn't dominate the longevity conversation.

item.title: Forget about RTO—companies are getting distracted with mandates and screwing up these 5 core work practices
item.description: Return-to-office mandates won’t necessarily make your employees more productive.

item.title: Norway announces $855 million funding for humanitarian NGOs amid Trump’s dismantling of USAID
item.description: The Norwegian funding had been intended to work alongside USAID, and humanitarian groups warned it wouldn't fill the black hole being left by the U.S.
